programme.title: Storage Wars
programme.sub-title: Midnight in the Gardena Good and Evil
programme.desc: Barry Weiss hires a psychic to tell him what he thinks is inside a locker and help him decide whether to purchase its contents.

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: The team is intrigued when handwritten lyrics to My Country, 'Tis of Thee arrive at the shop, but it remains to be seen whether they are the real deal.

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: An autographed picture of John Belushi and a Jim Henson puppet arrive in the shop, but it remains to be seen if any of them are worth big money.

programme.title: Hardcore Pawn
programme.desc: Ashley splashes out on a worthless roulette table, which sparks one of the biggest fights the Gold family has ever witnessed.

programme.title: Hardcore Pawn
programme.desc: Ashley returns to put Seth in his place. Meanwhile, a customer who has been robbed looks to sell her last remaining possession.

programme.title: American Restoration
programme.desc: Rick and his team examine a helicopter gunner's helmet from the Vietnam War and a 1940s vending machine.

programme.title: American Restoration
programme.desc: Rick Dale finds a barber's chair from the 1940s, and a client brings in a rare 1950s drinks machine.

programme.title: Conspiracy Rising
programme.desc: An investigation into the causes of conspiracy theories, the people who believe them, and how we separate fantasies from real threats..

programme.title: Unusual Suspects
programme.desc: |How police solved the murder of 58-year-old tax attorney Ashley Pollow, who was strangled and burned at his Florida home in December 2010

programme.title: Storage Wars: Texas
programme.desc: Jenny buys a storage unit that contains a locked safe - but she has no idea how to open it or what might be inside.

programme.title: Storage Wars: Texas
programme.sub-title: I'd Do Anything for Lesa (But I Won't Do That)
programme.desc: Jenny restores some old furniture, while tensions erupt between her, Lesa and Mary.

programme.title: Hardcore Pawn
programme.desc: A burglar is caught in the car park - and when she is taken inside the Golds get a big surprise.

programme.title: Hardcore Pawn
programme.desc: Les hands over a lot of money for an item based on the word of a customer, and later, Ashley makes a discovery that leaves him looking foolish.

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: The guys are awestruck by one of the rarest items ever to come through their doors - an artwork believed to be by Renaissance master Raphael.

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: A rare copy of Seven Years in Tibet signed by author Heinrich Harrer turns up at the shop, and Corey teams up with Chumlee to check out a Three Stooges promotional projector.

programme.title: Alien Files: Unsealed
programme.desc: An investigation into compelling UFO and alien cases by opening previously off-limits secret files. Does the mysterious Blue Planet Project hold the answers?.

programme.title: Ancient Aliens
programme.desc: Experts visit an ancient fortress in Peru believed to have been built by aliens using tools far more advanced than those thought to have been available to humans at the time.

programme.title: American Restoration
programme.desc: A Vegas Pawn Star hauls in a crumbling 1957 Chevy 150 for a much-needed restoration. The American Pickers rock up too, hoping to flog some of their vintage valuables..

programme.title: American Restoration
programme.desc: Rick Dale and the team restore a rusty 1920s tyre-changer, and a baseball game from the 1940s is given an urgent makeover.

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: Items include replica swords signed by Kill Bill actor David Carradine, a first-edition of TS Eliot's Four Quartets, a 1965 Battle of the Bulge board game, and a 1920s radium crock.

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: The action in the shop focuses on Rick as he gets wound up trying to complete some deals.

programme.title: Storage Wars
programme.desc: Brandi Passante and Jarrod Schulz enter into a fierce battle against rival Dave Hester as they search California's storage units for valuables and forgotten jewels.

programme.title: Storage Wars
programme.desc: The buyers travel to the latest set of auctions in Fullerton, California, where Jarrod and Brandi compete for a storage unit they need to keep their store afloat.

programme.title: Storage Wars: Texas
programme.desc: The buyers attend fiercely competitive auctions in Garland, where Moe and Mary find a rare historical artefact.

programme.title: Storage Wars: Texas
programme.desc: The buyers visit the Dallas suburb of Addison, where the Rangers find a nautical antique and Jenny uncovers a piece of Hollywood memorabilia.

programme.title: Forged in Fire
programme.desc: After two turbulent nautically themed rounds, two smiths head the final round to forge the Kachin Dao, a deadly headhunting sword.

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: A collection of original 1960s NBC posters arrive at the shop, and the team is asked to appraise a 1966 Harley Davidson.

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: The pawnbrokers examine a medal with links to Captain Cook, and a putter from the famed 1963 Frank Sinatra Invitational. Plus, Rick's stress levels hit a new high.

programme.title: Alien Files: Unsealed
programme.desc: A selection of recently declassified FBI files provides new evidence for the debate over whether alien life really exists, and theorists claim the Vatican may be hiding the truth.

programme.title: Ancient Aliens
programme.desc: Experts investigate alleged sightings of UFOs during the Black Death, and examine the theory that aliens may have inflicted the disease on the human race.

programme.title: Hardcore Pawn
programme.desc: Les is furious when a member of Seth's team makes a huge mistake, but Seth is unwilling to reveal the culprit so takes a stand against his father.

programme.title: Hardcore Pawn
programme.desc: Lese is furious to find broken merchandise in the shop and issues the ultimate threat for the next person who steps out of line.

programme.title: Storage Wars
programme.desc: The buyers are far from home and get the opportunity to find out who has the skills for the job and who is just relying on luck.

programme.title: Storage Wars
programme.desc: Darrell takes a gamble on a locker completely covered with blankets, while Brandi makes a risky decision.

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: The staff assess a pre-Revolutionary American pewter tankard, postcards by American artist Jean-Michel Basquiat and a 1960s Hydro-Cycle Barracuda watercraft.

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: Astronomer Edwin Hubble's autograph is appraised, along with an 1850s patent model self-lighting and extinguishing lantern. Also brought to the staff's attention are a Starrett Food Chopper and an 1871 British Martini-Henry Short Lever Rifle.

programme.title: Spiky Gold Hunters
programme.desc: The crew of the San Nicholas head into icy waters and cold conditions. Competition between the divers is fierce, but for one member of the team it will be their last trip..

programme.title: Monster Croc Wrangler
programme.desc: Animal helper Matt Wright and his team take on a dangerous challenge to ensure the survival of the saltwater crocodile. They must gather more than 20,000 unhatched eggs for relocation, but the fiercely protective reptilian mothers do not take well to their territory being invaded.

programme.title: Storage Wars
programme.desc: Brandi Passante and Jarrod Schulz enter into a fierce battle against rival Dave Hester as they search California's storage units for valuables and forgotten jewels.

programme.title: Storage Wars
programme.desc: The buyers travel to the latest set of auctions in Fullerton, California, where Jarrod and Brandi compete for a storage unit they need to keep their store afloat.

programme.title: QI
programme.desc: Mind-boggling comedy panel game in which Stephen Fry quizzes Alan Davies, Sean Lock, Rich Hall and Bill Bailey for more interesting answers on subjects beginning with the letter E, including exploration.

programme.title: Mock the Week
programme.desc: Dara O Briain presents a special compilation show featuring previously unbroadcast material, out-takes and favourite bits from the recent series of the satirical comedy quiz, when regular panellists Andy Parsons and Hugh Dennis were joined by guests including Rob Beckett, Miles Jupp, Romesh Ranganathan, Ed Byrne and Sara Pascoe.

programme.title: QI
programme.desc: Alan Davies, Jimmy Carr, Phill Jupitus and Johnny Vegas answer Stephen Fry's questions about eating. Correctness and even intelligence go out of the window in this quiz, in which the questions are so difficult points are awarded for the answers the host finds most interesting.

programme.title: QI
programme.desc: Mind-boggling comedy panel game in which Stephen Fry quizzes Alan Davies, Sean Lock, Rich Hall and Bill Bailey for more interesting answers on subjects beginning with the letter E, including exploration.

programme.title: Richard Osman's House of Games
programme.desc: Quiz in which four famous faces go toe-to-toe testing their general knowledge skills in a variety of entertaining trivia-based games across the week, with BBC Breakfast's Naga Munchetty, singer and actor Jordan Stephens, presenter and actress Sally Lindsay and comedian David O'Doherty kicking thing off. A daily winner is declared following a quick-fire round at the end of each show, and the weekly scores are tallied resulting in an overall champion being crowned on Friday.

programme.title: Mock the Week
programme.desc: Dara O Briain presents a special compilation show featuring previously unbroadcast material, out-takes and favourite bits from the recent series of the satirical comedy quiz, when regular panellists Andy Parsons and Hugh Dennis were joined by guests including Rob Beckett, Miles Jupp, Romesh Ranganathan, Ed Byrne and Sara Pascoe.

programme.title: The Indestructibles
programme.desc: Gendle and Tim are dropped into a downhill bike park and create a human marble run using motorbikes and riders wearing zorbs.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home.

programme.title: Cops UK: Bodycam Squad
programme.desc: Documentary following the work of the Staffordshire Police force, revealing what makes its officers tick, how they deal with the tragedies they inevitably have to face and how much they rely on each other and also their camaraderie.

programme.title: American Pickers
programme.desc: Mike and Frank follow a trail of junk in Illinois and find themselves waist-deep in a giant pile of bizarre items.

programme.title: Storage Hunters
programme.desc: Brandon Bernier and his wife Lori find a piece of rock 'n' roll history.

programme.title: Storage Hunters
programme.desc: Former boxer Brandon Bernier bids against his arch-rival Jesse on a movie monster.

programme.title: American Pickers
programme.desc: Mike Wolfe and Frank Fritz are in seventh heaven when Cheap Trick guitarist Rick Nielsen opens the doors to his private rock 'n' roll warehouse.

programme.title: American Pickers
programme.desc: Mike and Robbie sort through a property full of rusty relics and attend a lumberjack contest.

programme.title: Cop Car Workshop
programme.desc: Police officers request a new police support unit or riot van, while a stolen car chase ends with an X5 wedged in a hedge. Boss Mick Sweetmore goes back to the floor with Merseyside's mental health team and discovers another side to modern-day policing - as well as the poor state of the vehicle they are currently using.

programme.title: Top Gear
programme.desc: Jeremy Clarkson, Richard Hammond and James May head to the countryside where they harness a group of hi-tech tractors and try to cultivate their own source of fuel. Meanwhile, the Lamborghini Murcielago LP640 is put through its paces, and actress Kristin Scott Thomas is the Star in a Reasonably Priced Car.

programme.title: Cops UK: Bodycam Squad
programme.desc: An officer is assaulted by a man he is trying to take into custody for beating his partner.

programme.title: Sin City Motors
programme.desc: Steve Darnell and the team build a train-themed rat rod. Railroads are a big part of US history, but it remains to be seen whether they can they keep the project on track.

programme.title: Top Gear
programme.desc: Jeremy Clarkson, Richard Hammond and James May build their own stretch limousines out of other vehicles and use them to transport celebrities to the Brit Awards. Meanwhile, a Ford Mustang is put through its paces, and actress Billie Piper is the Star in a Reasonably Priced Car.

programme.title: Top Gear
programme.desc: Jeremy Clarkson, Richard Hammond and James May test-drive an Aston Martin DBS Convertible, a Ferrari California and a Lamborghini Gallardo Convertible through Romania, searching for the mountain highway built during the reign of the country's former dictator Nicolae Ceausescu - allegedly the best road to drive on in the world. Actor Eric Bana is the Star in a Reasonably Priced Car.

programme.title: QI XL
programme.desc: Stephen Fry hosts an extended edition of the comedy quiz show, in which he awards points for answers he finds most interesting. This edition sees Noel Fielding, Rhod Gilbert and Cariad Lloyd join regular panellist Alan Davies to tackle miscellaneous M-themed matters.

programme.title: Richard Osman's House of Games
programme.desc: Richard Osman hosts as BBC Breakfast's Naga Munchetty, singer Jordan Stephens, actor Sally Lindsay and comedian David O'Doherty test their general knowledge.

programme.title: Would I Lie to You?
programme.desc: John Bishop, Chris Addison, Joanna Page and Patsy Palmer join team captains David Mitchell and Lee Mack to hoodwink their opponents with absurd facts and plausible lies about themselves in the comedy panel show hosted by Rob Brydon.

programme.title: Would I Lie to You?
programme.desc: Chef Hugh Fearnley-Whittingstall and comedians Rhod Gilbert, Rufus Hound and Miranda Hart are the guests on the comedy panel show. Team captains David Mitchell and Lee Mack guide the contestants as they try to hoodwink their opponents with absurd facts and plausible lies about themselves. Presented by Rob Brydon.

programme.title: Live at the Apollo
programme.sub-title: Rich Hall, Mark Watson and Andrew Maxwell
programme.desc: Rich Hall hosts the stand-up show recorded at London's Hammersmith Apollo, doing his own thing before introducing routines by Mark Watson and Andrew Maxwell.

programme.title: Taskmaster
programme.desc: The competitors are lured to a wasteland for a challenge involving eggs and medical equipment. David Baddiel spray-paints his face and Jo Brand reveals her psychic superpowers. Presented by Greg Davies, with help from co-host Alex Horne.

programme.title: QI
programme.desc: Guests David Mitchell, Dara O Briain and Phill Jupitus join regular contributor Alan Davies and host Stephen Fry in the quiz show with a difference. Coming under discussion are subjects beginning with 'E', including Europe, with the questions so difficult that points are awarded for the most interesting answers.

programme.title: QI
programme.desc: Guests Jeremy Clarkson, Vic Reeves and Clive Anderson join regular contributor Alan Davies and host Stephen Fry in the quiz show with a difference. Coming under discussion is the ambitious 'E' subject - everything, with the questions so difficult that points are awarded for the most interesting answers.

programme.title: The Two Ronnies
programme.desc: New World and Tina Charles perform on the vintage comedy and variety show.

programme.title: The World at War
programme.desc: How the morale of the Third Reich, boosted by Germany's initial military successes, was shattered by the devastating defeat at Stalingrad, relentless Allied bombing raids and an attempt on Hitler's life. Narrated by Laurence Olivier.

programme.title: Impossible Engineering
programme.desc: How the world's biggest ship, designed to install oil platforms and lay pipelines, was inspired by a logging machine, a wire rope and 1940s shipbuilding techniques.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home.

programme.title: Napoleon: The Egyptian Campaign
programme.desc: Part one of two. The French general's 1798 military expedition to occupy Egypt, providing a base from which to attack English territory in the Indies.

programme.title: Impossible Engineering
programme.desc: The largest and most sophisticated radio telescope on the planet, which draws inspiration from geodesic dome designs and the work of 18th-century engineer Jean Marie Jacquard.

programme.title: Abandoned Engineering
programme.desc: An abandoned prison beneath the water, a tunnel in the heart of a mountain, concrete towers hidden in the woods and a rusting coastal relic.

programme.title: The World at War
programme.desc: Laurence Olivier narrates the story of the D-Day landings in June 1944, when the Allies launched the biggest ever amphibious invasion on the beaches of Normandy. Although both sides suffered heavy casualties, it proved to be the turning point in the war against Germany.

programme.title: Forbidden History
programme.sub-title: The Secrets of the Vatican Archives
programme.desc: Jamie Theakston visits Rome to speak to Church officials, expert archivists, scholars and authors about some of the historical treasures stored in the Vatican's exclusive archives.

programme.title: Impossible Engineering
programme.desc: The largest and most sophisticated radio telescope on the planet, which draws inspiration from geodesic dome designs and the work of 18th-century engineer Jean Marie Jacquard.

programme.title: Coast
programme.desc: The team travels from Dublin to Derry. On the way, Miranda Krestovnikoff visits the only beach race in Europe run under Jockey Club rules at Laytown Races and Alice Roberts finds herself sent to the Irish salt mines. Mark Horton investigates a lost year in the life of the world's first ocean liner, while Neil Oliver meets the Londonderry women who secretly witnessed the surrender of German U-Boats at the end of the Second World War.

programme.title: Forbidden History
programme.sub-title: The Secrets of the Murder Bureau
programme.desc: Jamie Theakston investigates a secret department of the Bulgarian government charged with carrying out assassinations in nine other countries during the Cold War.

programme.title: Planet Earth II
programme.desc: Footage of plants and animals that live in jungles, one of the hardest environments to thrive in, including strange fungi and creatures that glow in the dark which have never been captured on film before. The programme also includes recordings of caimans and the jaguars that prey on them, freshwater dolphins that swim through flooded forests, undergrowth-dwelling frogs that have to defend themselves against wasps, and the Indri, the world's largest living lemur, which inhabits the forests of Madagascar.

programme.title: Bangers and Cash
programme.desc: A widow reluctantly parts with her husband's treasured collection of Rolls Royces and Bentleys, and an impulse buyer finds one of the cars a new home.

programme.title: Abandoned Engineering
programme.desc: An abandoned prison beneath the water, a tunnel in the heart of a mountain, concrete towers hidden in the woods and a rusting coastal relic.

programme.title: The World at War
programme.desc: Laurence Olivier narrates the story of the D-Day landings in June 1944, when the Allies launched the biggest ever amphibious invasion on the beaches of Normandy. Although both sides suffered heavy casualties, it proved to be the turning point in the war against Germany.

programme.title: Steam Train Britain
programme.desc: Behind the scenes of three preserved steam railway lines - the South Devon Railway heritage line, the Ffestiniog and Welsh Highlands Railway and the Great Central Railway. Sports scientist Megan Smith has a dream of tending the fire of a steam locomotive on the Ffestiniog & Welsh Highland Railway, and she stokes the bolier of NG143 and sets off along the 25 miles from Caernarfon to Porthmadog.

programme.title: Abandoned Engineering
programme.desc: Concrete channels hidden in a mountaintop forest, a collapsing bridge, a marooned military base and the upright rusting carcass of ship.

programme.title: Abandoned Engineering
programme.desc: The underground base with the power to destroy a nation, the site linked with an attempt to kill a vicious dictator, and an ancient world discovered in the open American wilderness.

programme.title: The Two Ronnies
programme.desc: Classic comedy from Messrs Barker and Corbett, featuring an instalment of Hampton Wick.

programme.title: The Two Ronnies
programme.desc: New World and Tina Charles perform on the vintage comedy and variety show.

programme.title: Porridge
programme.desc: Peace evades the inmates of Slade Prison, and Fletcher's bid to find a little tranquillity seems destined to fail. Comedy, starring Ronnie Barker and Brian Wilde.

programme.title: Porridge
programme.desc: Blanco ends up in the prison hospital, where he fears he is about to shuffle off this mortal coil and entrusts the whereabouts of his stashed fortune to fellow inmate Fletch, who is sharing a ward with him. Comedy, starring Ronnie Barker and David Jason.

programme.title: Taggart
programme.desc: The Glaswegian detective is drawn into a suicide case where all is not as it seems - despite his usual attempts to stay out of such investigations. Drama, with Mark McManus, James MacPherson and Blythe Duff, with early appearances from Jason Isaacs (Star Trek Discovery), Deepak Verma (EastEnders) and Meera Syal (Paddington 2). It was directed by Gordon Flemyng, who helmed two Doctor Who big screen offerings, and classic episodes of The Avengers, The Saint and Minder.

programme.title: Soldier, Soldier
programme.desc: Joe receives some bad news from Collette, and his actions end up getting him into trouble. Meanwhile, an unexpected guest opens old wounds for Sam.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home.

programme.title: Bramwell
programme.desc: Period medical drama chronicling the personal and professional consequences of Eleanor Bramwell's determined quest to become the first female surgeon at the East London Hospital. Jemma Redgrave stars.

programme.title: Soldier, Soldier
programme.desc: A case of sexual assault puts Stacey in a difficult position and threatens to divide loyalties in the camp. Starring Kate O'Malley and Con O'Neill.

programme.title: The Bill
programme.desc: Gabriel learns Smithy reported him over Kerry's rape allegation and the two come to blows - but retribution comes from an unexpected source when the corrupt copper is gunned down by the Sun Hill sniper. Elsewhere, suspicion falls on Shirley after Yvonne's niece accidentally swallows an Ecstasy tablet, Ramani fears Terry is letting his personal preoccupations interfere with his police work, and a shamefaced Jim tells his colleagues that June has left him.

programme.title: Holby City
programme.desc: Zubin returns to head the new ITU team, but his arrival is not a pleasant one - the department isn't ready but is opening anyway and he ends up accusing Sean of hitting Jess. Mickie develops a crush on Connie, and Donna's debts catch up with her - so she gives the bailiffs Lisa's TV. Chrissie learns about a medical course in London and Diane demands Owen pick a date for the wedding.

programme.title: Casualty
programme.desc: Jude undergoes an emergency operation, and on hearing the news of her injury Matt decides to fly back from Crete. Meanwhile, Ken Summer comes under suspicion as the police gather witnesses in a bid to determine who is behind the stabbing.

programme.title: The Bill
programme.desc: New recruit PC Leela Kapoor proves her mettle on her first day at Sun Hill, but the exposure of a dark secret from her past sours her working relationship with Sheelagh. Jim contemplates stepping outside the law to pay off his gambling debts, while another shooting by the serial sniper leads to an influx of armed officers - one of whom, Sergeant Mark Rollins, just happens to be Lance's boyfriend.

programme.title: Classic EastEnders
programme.desc: The secret is out and Sam gets some unwelcome exposure.

programme.title: Classic EastEnders
programme.desc: Sam fears her marriage is on the rocks. Mark tries to keep calm as Gill's condition worsens, and Phil warns Grant that he may have pushed Sharon too far.

programme.title: London's Burning
programme.desc: Blue Watch is called out to extinguish a bonfire which has been prematurely set alight, but the fire fighters get caught up in an outbreak of gang warfare between local youths.

programme.title: Lovejoy
programme.desc: The roguish antiques dealer whisks Charlotte away for a weekend in Wales, but before long they find themselves hunting for a murderer and a rare Celtic cross. Drama, starring Ian McShane and Caroline Langrishe.

programme.title: Bergerac
programme.desc: Mystery surrounds the identity of a certain John Smythe, a man plagued by nightmares, and it's up to Jim to find out who he is. Police drama set in Jersey, starring John Nettles.

programme.title: Bread
programme.desc: Adrian is put through the wringer when he attempts to apply for social benefits and Aveline reveals she has met a nice boy in London.

programme.title: Are You Being Served?
programme.desc: Thieves break into Grace Bros and expect an easy job, without realising the first-floor staff are working late. Comedy, starring Mollie Sugden, Frank Thornton and John Inman.

programme.title: As Time Goes By
programme.desc: Lionel feels uncomfortable to be surrounded by so many females after Sandy joins Judith and Jean in the Pargetter household. Comedy, starring Judi Dench, Geoffrey Palmer, Jenny Funnell and Moira Brooker.

programme.title: Last of the Summer Wine
programme.desc: Truly spots a bottle with a message inside floating down the river, and decides to catch it - so enlists the help of Clegg, Billy and Alvin to follow its elusive course and eventually read the mysterious contents. Long-running comedy, starring Frank Thornton, Peter Sallis, Keith Clifford and Brian Murphy.

programme.title: Judge John Deed
programme.desc: The powers-that-be pile the pressure on Deed to acquit a violent MI5 informer who may be able to infiltrate the Real IRA, leading him to cross swords with the Lord Chancellor's department. To complicate matters, a furious Sir Ian Rochester suspects his wife may be having an affair with him and resolves to bring the maverick into line.

programme.title: New Tricks
programme.desc: Pilot episode of the crime drama, starring Amanda Redman as Superintendent Sandra Pullman, a rising star of the Met who is sidelined after a failed hostage rescue. Put in charge of a new department, she is dismayed to discover the unit is to be manned by a motley crew of old-school former detectives who know little about modern police procedure. However, when they re-examine the case of a man whose conviction for murder 20 years ago has just been overturned, their combined experience and unorthodox methods bring interesting results. Alun Armstrong, Dennis Waterman and James Bolam play Redman's veteran team, with Jon Finch, Tim Woodwork and Philip Bretherton.

credits.actor: Amanda Redman as Superintendent Sandra Pullman
a rising star of the Met who is sidelined after a failed hostage rescue

programme.title: Taggart
programme.desc: In an episode originally screened in 1992, the long suffering Scottish detective tries to defend a childhood friend recently released from prison when a series of shootings puts him in the frame for murder. Mark McManus stars as gruff crime buster Jim Taggart, while series regulars Blythe Duff (DS Jackie Reid) and James MacPherson (Mike Jardine) also star. There's also an appearance from Clare Grogan, best known for her work with the band Altered Images and cult TV hit Red Dwarf.

programme.title: Sky News at 9
programme.desc: A round-up of the stories that have hit the headlines today, featuring reports from correspondents around the world. Presented by Anna Botting.

programme.title: Sky News at 9
programme.desc: A round-up of the stories that have hit the headlines today, featuring reports from correspondents around the world. Presented by Anna Botting.

programme.title: Sky News at 10
programme.desc: A round-up of the stories that have hit the headlines today, with Anna Botting.

programme.title: Press Preview
programme.desc: A preview of the stories appearing in tomorrow's national newspapers.

programme.title: Sky News Tonight
programme.desc: A round-up of the day's leading stories with Anna Botting.

programme.title: Press Preview
programme.desc: A preview of the stories appearing in tomorrow's national newspapers.

programme.title: Inside the Crown: Secrets of the Royals
programme.desc: Major documentary telling the inside story of the royal family and the Queen's record-breaking reign. The first episode focuses on the conflict between love and duty that faces the royals - and which has occasionally threatened to bring down the House of Windsor. Edward VIII fatefully chose love when he abdicated to marry divorcee Wallis Simpson. Charles chose duty when he married Diana. The Queen, however, has managed to find a balance, maintaining a long marriage while becoming the longest-serving monarch.

programme.title: Rebound
programme.desc: Sean Fletcher hosts the quickfire quiz that tests the general knowledge of six contestants, who go head to head in a bid to walk away with a big cash prize. The players must give as many correct answers as they can in the time it takes the 'Rebound Bar' to move across the studio, with the money on offer rising accordingly.

programme.title: Tenable
programme.desc: Five friends calling themselves the Science Alliance answer questions about top 10 lists from the realms of pop culture and general knowledge, then try to score a perfect 10 in the final round to take home the prize money. Game show, hosted by Warwick Davis.

programme.title: ITV Nightscreen
programme.desc: Text-based information service.

programme.title: Judge Rinder
programme.desc: Cameras follow criminal barrister Robert Rinder as he takes on real-life cases in a studio courtroom..

programme.title: Good Morning Britain
programme.desc: Morning magazine featuring a lively mix of news and current affairs, plus health, entertainment and lifestyle features.

programme.title: Lorraine
programme.desc: Entertainment, current affairs and fashion news, as well as showbiz stories and celebrity gossip. Presented by Lorraine Kelly.

programme.title: This Morning
programme.desc: A mix of celebrity chat, lifestyle features, advice and competitions.

programme.title: Loose Women
programme.desc: More celebrity interviews and topical debate from a female perspective.

programme.title: STV News and Weather
programme.desc: Including regional weather forecast.

programme.title: Judge Rinder
programme.desc: Christine is in court on behalf of herself and her brother to claim 4,800 for their share of the rent on their late grandfather's property.

programme.title: Tenable
programme.desc: Quiz hosted by Warwick Davis in which a team of five family and friends answers questions about top 10 lists from the realms of pop culture and general knowledge, then tries to score a perfect 10 in the final round to take home the prize money.

programme.title: Tipping Point
programme.desc: Ben Shephard hosts the quiz in which contestants answer questions to win turns on an arcade-style machine. Dropping tokens down a choice of four chutes, they hope to knock piles of them off a moving shelf - and the more they collect, the greater the prize fund. The player who has won the least amount is then eliminated, and the last one standing competes for a 10,000 jackpot.

programme.title: The Chase
programme.desc: Bradley Walsh presents as contestants Abi, Macauley, Steve and Jeanne pit their wits against ruthless quiz genius the Chaser in the hope of winning a potential prize pot worth thousands of pounds. They work as a team and play strategically to answer general knowledge questions against the clock and race down the game board to the exit without being caught.

programme.title: STV News at Six and Weather
programme.desc: Including regional weather forecast.

programme.title: Emmerdale
programme.desc: Jai is alarmed by what he hears, while Charity is floored by what she learns and wants answers.

programme.title: The National Television Awards
programme.desc: David Walliams hosts the annual awards ceremony where the winners are chosen by viewers' votes live from the O2, east London, in the event's 25th anniversary year. Shows in the running for awards include Derry Girls, Gentleman Jack, RuPaul's Drag Race UK, Chernobyl, Jesy Nelson: 'Odd One Out', The Capture, A Confession and After Life. Among the famous faces in attendance are Graham Norton, Tess Daly, Claudia Winkleman, Ant and Dec, Tom Jones, who is making his first appearance in the Best Judge category for The Voice UK, and the stars of Gavin & Stacey.

programme.title: ITV News at Ten
programme.desc: A fresh perspective on the major stories of the day, featuring national and international news, with reports and analysis from ITV's correspondents.

programme.title: Scotland Tonight
programme.desc: Analysis of the day's headlines from a Scottish perspective, plus local news from Aberdeen, Edinburgh and Glasgow.

programme.title: White House Farm
programme.desc: After a vital discovery at the farm, Stan and Mick feel closer to shoring up their own suspicions about Jeremy. The arrival of Brett, a friend from New Zealand (played by Game of Thrones star Alfie Allen), increases tensions between Jeremy and Julie, while Ann grows ever more alarmed and suspicious of her cousin Jeremy's behaviour, and his handling of the family estate. As preparations for the inquest continue, Stan is concerned that if the bodies are released for cremation, vital evidence will be lost for ever.

programme.title: How Do They Do It?
programme.desc: A look at how monorails are built above the world's most crowded streets, and how Copenhagen's famous Flora Danica porcelain is crafted.

programme.title: Wheeler Dealers
programme.desc: Mike Brewer finds a Cadillac coupe with minimal rust and damage. However, the interior is a different story meaning Edd China faces a challenge to turn a profit on its renovation.

programme.title: Chasing Classic Cars
programme.desc: Wayne Carini bids on a 1949 BMV Veritas and hopes to get a classic Thor motorbike up and running.

programme.title: Chasing Classic Cars
programme.desc: Car restorer Wayne Carini visits McPherson College looking for three apprentices to join his team. The students assemble a Model T and the winners are announced.

programme.title: Wheels That Fail
programme.desc: Including people shedding their clothes and inhibitions on the road, horrible parking that breaks all the rules, and a momentous truck manoeuvre which ends in disaster.

programme.title: Wheels That Fail
programme.desc: Featuring people who demonstrate an unusual affection for their cars, and a vicious, endless battle between cars and bikes.

programme.title: Destroyed in Seconds
programme.desc: A blaze at a fireworks factory sparks a massive explosion, two pilots survive a fiery crash-landing on an aircraft carrier, and a car is driven into a restaurant.

programme.title: Destroyed in Seconds
programme.desc: A rocket explosion scatters bystanders who fear for their lives, six racing cars are destroyed in a crash on a wet track, and a bull rider is trampled by his animal.

programme.title: Heli-Loggers
programme.desc: Deadlines approach for trees to be airlifted using a $15,000-per-hour Chinook helicopter, but the loggers suffer a crushing double setback.

programme.title: Overhaulin'
programme.desc: Chip Foose and the team visit Atlanta and meet the reporters, cameramen and engineers who covered the Iraq war for CNN back in 2003.

programme.title: How Do They Do It?
programme.desc: A look at how New York bagels are hand-rolled, how they make a racing car tyre that will grip the track at 320kph, and how life-like sculptures are created out of glass.

programme.title: Salvage Hunters: The Restorers
programme.desc: The artisan restorers save a quirky counter, a 100-piece chandelier and a vintage football table. Plus, a 100-year-old shop counter is rescued from a bonfire.

programme.title: Deadliest Catch
programme.desc: As the fishing season continues, so does the danger faced by the fleet. A deckhand is badly hurt, and the rest of the crew members take him ashore so his injuries can be treated.

programme.title: Gold Divers: Under the Ice
programme.desc: Setbacks on board The Clark cause tempers to flare, and Jesse risks his life to rescue a piece of lost equipment.

programme.title: Outback Truckers
programme.desc: Kurt gets lost while hauling a hut across Australia, while Johnny drags a stack of steel - and a dust cloud - along an intimidating desert track.

programme.title: Wheeler Dealers
programme.desc: Mike Brewer seeks a challenge in the form of a 1970 Ford Bronco, which is riddled with rust. The project seems to be seconds from disaster, but Edd China keeps his cool.

programme.title: Supertruckers
programme.desc: John, Steve, Deano and Simon move four huge 90-ton dumper trucks from south Wales to Tilbury docks, Essex. Plus, Arran takes modular homes from Hull to a school in Bedford.

programme.title: Nasa's Unexplained Files
programme.desc: The show attempting to explain baffling space imagery captured by Nasa cameras returns, beginning with unexplained transmissions on the moon, and a strange object that stalked a Russian spacecraft through orbit.

programme.title: Railroad Australia
programme.desc: Cracks appear in a multi-billion-dollar iron ore railroad. Plus, learner driver James must survive the punishing Cockatoo run and the ire of instructor Dave Boyd.

programme.title: Deadliest Catch
programme.desc: The midpoint of the season looms, and working without sleep means the fishermen begin to suffer from fatigue. Harsh weather makes the fleet's task even more perilous than usual and professional efficiency soon gives way to a slow grind as morale is tested.

programme.title: Gold Divers: Under the Ice
programme.desc: With Cody out of action, Phil gets a chance to redeem himself and hopes extra training will restore his confidence. Meanwhile, a tired tender puts Jesse's life in danger.

programme.title: Salvage Hunters
programme.desc: Drew Pritchard searches for items worthy of restoration at the former Naval Royal Hospital School in Suffolk, where he learns a few lessons while trying to negotiate a deal.

programme.title: Outback Truckers
programme.desc: There's trouble in the wind for Kurt, who is struggling with a load causing oversized problems. Meanwhile, for Johnny on the Tanami Track, it's too hard one minute and too soft the next.

programme.title: Wheeler Dealers
programme.desc: Mike Brewer finds a Cadillac coupe with minimal rust and damage. However, the interior is a different story meaning Edd China faces a challenge to turn a profit on its renovation.

programme.title: Salvage Hunters: The Restorers
programme.desc: A fancy fairground waltzer, an ancient coffee machine and a huge oak table are restored in the workshops of some of the UK's most celebrated crafts people.

programme.title: Salvage Hunters
programme.desc: Drew Pritchard and Tee John enjoy a tour of the Midlands. In Walsall, they have a money-spinning idea, in Birmingham Drew finds treasure and they also explore a grand country house.

programme.title: Born Mucky: Life on the Farm
programme.desc: A one-ton bull causes problems for Ian as he attempts to grow his cattle herd. Plus, a potentially disastrous barn fire keeps Tom and Joe alert as they stack the hay harvest.

programme.title: Find It, Fix It, Flog It
programme.desc: Henry Cole gives Simon O'Brien a motorcycling masterclass in Wiltshire as the duo seek more items to fix up and sell on to make profits for their owners.

programme.title: How Do They Do It?
programme.desc: Investigating how one of the slipperiest substances known to man is used to make waterproof clothing for explorers, mountaineers and special forces soldiers.

programme.title: How Do They Do It?
programme.desc: How oranges are turned into marmalade, and a look at printed dresses.

programme.title: FBI Case Files
programme.desc: FBI agents are baffled when a pizza delivery man robs a bank while wearing a bomb that explodes minutes later and kills him.

programme.title: Forensic Detectives
programme.desc: Tyre marks and fibres snare a murderer who stabbed two women, and a man stages an 'accident' to kill his wife.

programme.title: Copycat Killers
programme.desc: The case of teenage lovers Kim Edwards and Lucas Markham, who became convinced that the only way they can be together was to murder Kim's mother, Elizabeth, who had tried to break them up many times.

programme.title: Murder Comes to Town
programme.desc: The murder of a family of five in Beason, Illinois, in September 2009. Armed robber Chris Harris was later convicted of killing Rick and Ruth Gee and three of their children.

programme.title: FBI Files
programme.desc: A seemingly charming and generous man who targets vulnerable women for his vicious attacks is tracked in a country-wide manhunt.

programme.title: Animal Cops Philadelphia
programme.desc: A dog arrives at the shelter after being attacked by another animal and left without veterinary treatment.

programme.title: Bondi Vet
programme.desc: Dr Chris Brown tries to help a West Highland terrier overcome his phobia of skateboards and visits the Australian Reptile Park to take swabs from an alligator and a python.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress
programme.desc: During the sample sale, a brother and sister hunt for the perfect dress, and the new members of staff are put under pressure.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress
programme.desc: Erin wants a blue dress for her wedding, but must persuade her sceptical entourage, while Kate goes in search of a unique gown.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress: Atlanta
programme.desc: Tinnell had already found her dream dress, but didn't buy it because she wanted to stay within her budget, while Tykesha's outspoken daughter is a tough customer.

programme.title: Bondi Vet
programme.desc: Tim has his hands full with some lively little Tasmanian Devils, Chris meets a pug with an overly long tongue and Lisa fears for a ragdoll cat's weak legs.

programme.title: Animal Cops Houston
programme.desc: The team faces the difficult task of catching and transporting two emus to the Houston SPCA. A routine capture becomes an emergency rescue.

programme.title: Animal Cops Houston
programme.desc: Stephen Goldman checks on a breeder's kennels, only to discover 100 American bulldogs living in unhealthy conditions.

programme.title: Money for Nothing
programme.desc: Jay Blades is at Walsall recycling centre on a mission to save three unwanted items, coming away with a pair of dining chairs, a well-used table and some discarded DJ equipment.

programme.title: Forensic Detectives
programme.desc: An insight into the vital role of DNA analysis in solving crimes, and how the discovery of a single hair or drop of blood can help to put a criminal behind bars.

programme.title: Disappeared
programme.desc: A case in which a mother and Bible teacher went missing from her family's farm. Investigators in Missouri had to decipher a cryptic handwritten note, while a walk in nearby woods uncovered a mysterious skull.

programme.title: Disappeared
programme.desc: The case of 38-year-old Eric Franks, who vanished while preparing to move house with his long-lost high school girlfriend and the daughter they had together. However, he failed to called his mother after March 2011, leaving police struggling for answers as to his whereabouts.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress
programme.desc: Trisha's father helps her pick out a dress, while Caitlin has her fitting now that her dad is well enough to attend.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress
programme.desc: Crystal seeks a dress designed by Pnina Tornai, while Deborah feels a strong connection with Diana, Princess of Wales, and is determined to have her own royal wedding.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress
programme.desc: Cynthia's veil clashes with her dress, causing mayhem, while Passant is running out of time with a limited selection of outfits.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress
programme.desc: Second-time bride Becky hunts for a dress to make up for her disastrous first wedding, while Monica prepares to wed - four years after buying her gown.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress
programme.desc: Tamara looks for a gown that makes a statement, while Stephanie arrives for her fitting, not yet convinced she has bought the right dress.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress
programme.desc: The salon has a big sale - one of four a year - giving the brides an opportunity to snap up designer dresses at bargain prices.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress
programme.desc: Tall Rebecca is on the hunt for a dress with the wow factor, but is afraid everything will come up too short, while Valerie is a small bride with big dress dreams.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress
programme.desc: Stephanie wants to kick off Christmas with a Black Friday wedding, while Katie is hoping to look like an ice princess for her winter wonderland ceremony.

programme.title: Salvage Hunters
programme.desc: Modern-day treasure hunter Drew Pritchard makes a startling find at a 13th-century house in the Lake District. Later, he visits a classic car collector in Hertfordshire.

programme.title: Money for Nothing
programme.desc: Jay Blades is at Walsall recycling centre on a mission to save three unwanted items, coming away with a pair of dining chairs, a well-used table and some discarded DJ equipment.

programme.title: My 600lb Life
programme.desc: At over 700lbs, Teretha's life is confined to a bed. Her family fears losing her and hopes a gastric bypass will provide the solution she needs to save her life.

programme.title: My 600lb Life
programme.desc: JT is almost 900lbs with a 100-lb lymphedema mass on his leg and a dangerous food addiction. When his girlfriend takes him to Houston, his behaviour drives her away.

programme.title: FBI Case Files
programme.desc: The case of a 10-year-old girl abducted in front of her home by a predator in a white truck. FBI agents were tasked with finding Pamela before it was too late.
